@nnnnicholas @awkweb good point. C and SI both require you to Sign on-chain actions.

SI lets you take off-chain CRUD actions that do not require signature.

so i think the distinction in UX is more about on-chain v off-chain actions than it is Connect vs Sign-in

1/2

@nnnnicholas @awkweb i think SI is accurate if you are authenticating a traditional web session. the wallet signature is playing the role of a password, similar to oauth.

siwe is a standard for the flow of signing a nonce and how thatâ€™s implemented. since everyone was doing it differently.

@BrantlyMillegan @ensdesigner @signinwitheth got it. if you're going Full mode by default, then the toggle could be framed as an "opt-out", citing the technical difference between the two as a benefit with less features as a trade-off.

@BrantlyMillegan @ensdesigner @signinwitheth I love the idea to support tiers like this. UX-wise, this design may force a decision too far from the impact. I don't know if I value those additional features yet.

Could use Lite by default, and then prompt an upgrade to Full when I try to use those features in-app.
